name: Penha Longa Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the hotel based upon the rating on Tripadvisor and weren't disappointed. The staff are personable and as friendly as you want to be. We ate in all the restaurants and as a veggie was well catered for including the Japanese/sushi restaurant. Our favourite place was the bar with its lovely big comfy sofas and a menu that suited us. We did need to change rooms due to being given an interconnecting room so we did hear next door but the room change was swift and painless. We were there for a rest which we got and the spa was just lovely with the garden well worth a chill out in afterwards. We were there for 10 days and would go back in a heart beat (and we don't play golf).
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Setting and Great Staff

likes.liked: — Its a large hotel that didn't feel large or impersonal.

reviews.text: I cannot tout enough the absolutely wonderful time that my husband, seven year old daughter , and I had at Penha Longa at the end of August. First, the staff is extraordinary in the care with which they meet their guests' needs and expectations from the moment you enter the lobby. And they do so without being obsequious. Second, the facility is superb--the room, the outdoor and indoor pools, and the restaurants. Third, the grounds are gorgeous. I would like to say a special word re the Club Floor on which we stayed. We paid the extremely reasonable rate which included enjoying five "meals" during the course of the day. I am still marvelling at the quality of those meals and the superb ratio of value to that quality. Breakfast, lunch, afternoon snack, hors d'oeuvres, and nightcaps/dessert were the "meals" served over the course of the day. And they truly were meals. A huge array of cheese, cold meats, salads, breads, fruit, soups, stews, pastries and cakes, flan, and so on and so forth greeted us every day. Moreover, drinks (alcoholic and non-alcoholic) flowed all day. It was a wonderful way to learn about Portuguese wines (both still and sparkling). Finally, the staff on the Club Floor were extraordinary. Without exception, they were charming, helpful, and knowledgeable. They were extremely solicitous of our daughter which made her feel very special and increased her enjoyment (and thereby ours) of our vacation. Bottom line, I cannot recommend this resort highly enough and would definitely suggest that if you go to the resort that you stay on the Club Floor.
reviews.title: Penha Long Is Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot rate them highly enough and I will use this hotel as a benchmark in the future! We booked for a club level room for a week in September and loved every single minute of it. From the moment we were whisked by the hotel limo from the airport until we left the hotel (again in the hotel limo which is recommended if you do not intend to drive since Portugese taxi drivers drive like mad) we had an amazing time.
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.liked: — Quiet location, beautiful scenery, great food, staff, everything!
likes.disliked: — A slight drip of the shower in the bathroom. nothing serious.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The club lounge has a lovely terrace that overlooks the forest and the resort where we had numerous enjoyable breakfasts/lunch/drinks/dinner....sitting under the sun sipping champagne, pure heaven.
reviews.title: Lots of positives but....

reviews.text: It boasts an excellent choice of yummy pastries and fruits, yoghurts, ham, cheese, eggs, juices in the morning, again lovely choices of salads, appetizers, hot and cold dishes for lunch, afternoon tea, pre-dinner buffet. Champagnes, red and white wines and soft drinks available at all times (no alcohol for breakfast!)
reviews.title: Gutted leaving, can't wait to get back!

likes.liked: — Lots of activities at hotel plus great food, also not too far from beach/shopping.
likes.disliked: — Dining room for breakfast too small and sometimes had to queue for 20 mins!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was wonderful and we would highly recommend it. The staff was welcoming and helpful from the moment we arrived (and even offered us a glass of Portuguese wine during check-in). The staff was very helpful in assisting us with directions and recommendations for the area. The rooms were very large for Europe. The pool area was very nice and relaxing - not at all crowded. The hotel is a short drive from Lisbon and definitely worth the trip. The grounds are very charming. The golf course was excellent and again, not crowded. We cannot wait to return.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel
A wonderful hotel
reviews.text: My husband and two children(14 and 12) stayed at Penha Longa for a week at the end of July. It is an excellent hotel with superb staff and facilities . The hotel is set in a beautiful estate with a 14th century palace and monastic buildings which have been wonderfully restored - we had a memorable meal in the old monastry one evening. We adored the outdoor swimming pool (there is also an indoor pool) and the golf courses but there is plenty to do for non-golfers or sporty types- the hotel has daily activities such as looking after a pony for the day or learning how to make delicious patisseries !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was wonderful and the staff utterly charming. This hotel puts ours in the UK to shame.
reviews.title: Hidden Beauty

likes.disliked: — Had to Pay for Internet access

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Penha Longa to celebrate our 5 year anniversary. We were in Barcelona for 5 activity filled days and Penha Longa was exactly what we needed to unwind and relax before returning to the U.S. I would suggest renting a car if plan to leave the resort. But if your plan is resort focused - you are in for a treat.
reviews.title: Paradise Found: Penha Longha Hotel & Golf Resort

likes.liked: — Everything - from the luxurious rooms to the excellent service and beautiful views. All great!
likes.disliked: — That we only booked a week! :(

reviews.title: A wonderful experience
reviews.text: The golf course was gorgeous - I don't play so I can't give you more than that. The fitness center and both pools were top of the line. Our room (which was a standard room not a suite) was well decorated, spacious, and well maintained during our stay.The bathroom was a room by itself. They could beef up the room service menu.
My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in July after a couple of nights in Lisbon.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful - gorgeous communal areas, and spotless, large rooms. The bed was amazingly comfortable, and the towels lovely too. We had a plasma tv with lots of good British channels - we were even able to watch a bit of Wimbledon!
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem

likes.disliked: — Being the only guests using the Club Level facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was amazing - I dont really like hot breakfast which some reviewers have criticised so I didnt even try it. I was more than happy with the fresh fruit, cereals, and some stewed plums which were amazing mixed in with yoghurt!
reviews.title: Luxury and Brilliant Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was lovely, and they had some great cushioned sofas/deck chairs, though you had to grab those early. The staff came round with drinks and fruit or free which was much appreciated.
reviews.title: Paradise in Portugal

likes.disliked: — There was nothing to complain about.

reviews.text: We ate our lunch in the poolside bar, and we also tried the Japanese buffet which was outstanding, and the new Spanish restuarant - this was a little disappointing as the chef went way too heavy on the salt! We ate in Sintra the rest of the time which is a beautiful town to visit. Be aware the hotel food is not cheap - we avoided Assamassa as I felt 30 euros for a main course was a bit pricey!
reviews.title: Best ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is easily the most-bargain priced Ritz-Carlton around - GO HERE!!!! We spent the first part of our honeymoon here and it was divine. We arrived to a plate of chocolate covered strawberries, a bed covered in fresh rosepetals, and bathrobes laid out on the bed for us. The Bvlgari toiletries in the bathroom are a nice touch. The room was absolutely gorgeous and comfortable and we loved looking out over the mountains.
reviews.title: Amazing Honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: DEFINITELY BOOK THE CLUB ROOM - I don't know why more people didn't do it. They reset with different food 6 times a day and we were able to have as much champagne, red, and white wine as we wanted and cordials in the evening. Plus, they always serve something that is "entree-like" so you wouldn't even have to go to dinner if you didn't want to. We saved a lot of money and were able to try a bunch of different dishes by going for appetizers and breakfast there. Plus, you get your own personal concierge for assistance on the floor.
reviews.title: Splendid location, perfect service
5-Star Relaxation
reviews.text: This was a deal and a really beautiful resort! Great for relaxing and not doing much of anything.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly staff, beautiful site in the middle of an ancient estate. Rooms are stunning, great breakfast and the hotel restaurants are the best we had in portugal. Good location to discover Sintra area, if you have a (rental) car.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel

reviews.text: The spa treatments are recommended as well.
reviews.title: ***Fabulous!***

description: Walk in the footsteps of royalty along the gorgeous Estoril coastal region of Portugal. Penha Longa Resort traces its origins back to the 16th century, includes a landmark monastery that was built on its ground and has been a frequent retreat of Portuguese royal and foreign dignitaries. A graceful palazzo-style estate set amongst the spectacular rolling hills, lush gardens, and clear lakes of the southern Sintra mountains.The Penha Longa Resort features: 194 well-appointed guest rooms Five exceptional dining facilities Two world-class, championship golf courses A state-of-the-art 1,500 square meter spa Numerous indoor and outdoor recreational amenities
